SEARCH
Package smarthome.entities.inhabitants

Class Inhabitant

java.lang.Object
smarthome.entities.inhabitants.Inhabitant
Direct Known Subclasses:
Adult, Animal, Baby, Child
public abstract class Inhabitant extends Object
The Inhabitant class represents an abstract entity capable of performing tasks, interacting with events, and navigating between different rooms. It provides a basic structure for handling tasks and events, and can be extended to define specific behaviors for different types of inhabitants. Subclasses must implement the abstract methods canHandle(Event) and processEvent(Event) to specify the conditions under which an event can be handled and the manner in which it is processed.

  • Method Details

    • handleEvent

      public boolean handleEvent(Event event)
      Handles the provided event by determining whether it can be processed by the current inhabitant.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to be handled. It contains information about its source and location.
      Returns:
      true if the event was successfully handled by this inhabitant or a subsequent one in the chain; false if no inhabitant in the chain was able to handle the event.

    • setNext

      public void setNext(Inhabitant next)

    • canHandle

      protected abstract boolean canHandle(Event event)
      Determines if the current inhabitant is capable of handling the specified event.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to check. Contains details such as its source and location.
      Returns:
      true if the inhabitant can handle the event; false otherwise.

    • processEvent

      protected abstract void processEvent(Event event)
      Processes the specified event, allowing the inhabitant to take actions or assign tasks based on the event's type and details.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to be processed. Provides information such as its source and location.

    • assignTask

      public void assignTask(Task task)
      Assigns the specified task to the task queue of the inhabitant.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to be assigned. This task will be added to the inhabitant's task queue for execution or tracking.

    • useAvailableObject

      public void useAvailableObject(List<UsableObject> usableObjects)
      Attempts to use an available UsableObject from the provided list of usable objects. If the current inhabitant is busy, no action is taken. The method iterates through the list of usable objects to find a free object, assigns a task to use it, moves to the object's location, and uses the object.
      Parameters:
      usableObjects - A list of UsableObject instances that can potentially be used by the inhabitant. The method will iterate over these objects to check their availability.

    • progressTask

      public void progressTask()
      Attempts to make progress on the task at the front of the task queue. If the queue is empty, no action is performed. If a task exists at the front of the queue, its progress method is called. If the task is completed (indicated by the progress method returning true), it is removed from the queue.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(Room nextRoom)
      Moves the inhabitant to a specified room. Updates the current room's state by removing the inhabitant and adds the inhabitant to the specified next room if it is not null.
      Parameters:
      nextRoom - The room to which the inhabitant will be moved. If null, the inhabitant will be marked as not home.

    • getLocation

      public Room getLocation()

    • isBusy

      public boolean isBusy()

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
